oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Enon Missionary Baptist: church front
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of church front. The one and a half story church consists of brick. The facade features an elaborate mosaic of colored glass panes connecting the gable to the top of the entrance. A set of glass double doors is flanked by glass windows, measuring the same size as the doors. The church cornerstone is located at the bottom left side of the facade.

Enon Missionary Baptist Church, located on Walnut Avenue, is one of two Enon Missionary Baptist Churches in McKenzie, Tennessee. It sits in an African American section of town. The other church resides about two to three miles outside of town on Highway 79. According to the fieldnotes, the other church may historically have a white congregation. The church dates from 1912 and underwent remodeling in 1968. At the time of fieldwork, J. Stewart served as pastor.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; Church buildings
